intro: Leandra alpestris, commonly known as the alpine leandra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. This species is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Leandra alpestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural alpine environment.
